result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael C Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 15CF147 and 15CM109 called together at 9:20am [mo]
Defendant Michael C Schmidt in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

ADA Hall orally motions to amend the Criminal Complaint in Case 15CM109 to add the underlined information in the Fort Atkinson Police Department Report
--No Objection from Atty. Svehlek 
ADA Hall orally motions to amend the charging language in Count #2 of Case 15CM109 to read 'Loren Gerrits'
--No Objection from Atty. Svehlek
ADA Hall submits victim impact statement and restitution request to the Court.
ADA Hall orally motions for the Victim Impact Statement and Restitution request be added to to factual basis of Count #2 of Case 15CM109
--No objection from Atty. Svehlek

The Court orders that the underlined portions of the Fort Atkinson Police Department Report and the Victim Impact Statement, along with Restitution Request from Mr. Scott Erdman be supplemented to the factual information of Count #2 of Case 15CM109

As to Case 15CF147: Mr. Schmidt  waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Case 15CM109 Count #1 and Case 15CF147 Counts #2 and #4; factual basis stipulated as to amended Case 15CM109 and charged Case 15CF147; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2 of Case 15CM109 and Counts #1 and #3 of Case 15CF147

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--Atty. Svehlek indicates that the restitution amount requested is stipulated

On Case 15CM109 Count #1 and Case 15CF147 Counts #2 and #4, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to maintain absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--Comply with all mental health professionals
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--No contact with Loren Gerrits, Kelly Price, or Tina Kruse unless both they and the agent agree
-- On Count #1 of Case 15CM109: submit DNA sample upon demand to designee/ Sheriff
--On Case 15CM109 pay restitution in the amount of $500 to Scott Erdman
--On Case 15CM109 Count #1: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Case 15CF147 Count #2: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge
--On Case 15CF147 Count #4: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 10:02am

Cases 15CM109 and 15CF147 called together at 8:34am
15CF147 scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today//15CM109 for Status
Defendant Michael C Schmidt  appears via video conferencing from MMHI, in custody, His Attorney, Elizabeth F. Svehlek appears in court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.


Case 15CF147:
The Court questions the legality of having Mr. Schmidt appear via video for the Preliminary Hearing, which is evidentiary in nature.
The Court inquires of Atty. Svehlek whether a speedy demand has been made; Atty. Svehlek waives all right to speedy preliminary hearing; requests pretrial conference and 
ADA Hall waives time limits; notes that she does have an officer present to testify
ADA Hall recites statutes pertaining to Mr. Schmidt being present in courtroom at Preliminary Hearing
The Court concludes that since a Preliminary Hearing is evidentiary in nature, Mr. Schmidt must be present. 
The Court directs for the Prelim to be re-scheduled to allow Mr. Schmidt to be present in the courtroom. 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling

Case 15CM109 is to track with 15CF147 status to occur at the Preliminary hearing of CF file.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance in both files

recess: 8:44am

Cases 15CF147 and 15CM109 called together at 9:02am [mo]
Defendant Michael C Schmidt appears via videoconferencing from MMHI, in custody. His Attorney, Elizabeth F. Svehlek appears in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Despite the Jefferson County Courtroom being unable to see MMHI, the audio was working sufficiently and MMHI could both see and hear the courtroom, therefore upon stipulation from the parties, The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient for the purposes of todays procedures. 

As to Case 15CF147(Initial Appearance occurs):
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time limit

Atty. Svehlek and ADA Shock notify the Court that a bond hearing occurred.
The Court continues the bond previously set in this case.
The Court directs the Clerk to update this file to include the minutes and signature bond from the bond hearing. 


As to Case 15CM109(Status Conference Occurs):
The Court notes that this case will track with 15CF147; and therefore the Preliminary Hearing date for the CF case will be a status for the CM case. 
recess: 9:10am

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing/Status Conference: June 15, 2015 at 8:30am

Case called at 1:19 pm [sf]
Defendant Michael Cody Schmidt appears in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court inquires if probable cause has been found.
Attorney Flint advises that she can give a oral presentation for probable cause and the state is requesting 30 days to file a complaint.
Attorney Svehlek advises the defendant is on conditional release.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence against any person
-Not to possess any dangerous weapons as defined by statute
-No contact with Tina Kruse unless she approves in writing and it is approved by his DOC Superviser Stacey Bieberitz
-No contact with Robert Lemke or Thomas Hogenmiller
-Fingerprints and Photos

Court advises that the State has 30 days to file a complaint if no complaint has been filed the bond shall lapse as a matter of law.
Recess: 1:25 pm
